workflow.name: Automate Competitor Research with Exa.ai, Notion and AI Agents
workflow.description:
This n8n workflow demonstrates a simple multi-agent setup to perform the task of competitor research. It showcases how using the HTTP request tool could reduce the number of nodes needed to achieve a workflow like this.

## How it works
* For this template, a source company is defined by the user which is sent to Exa.ai to find competitors.
* Each competitor is then funnelled through 3 AI agents that will go out onto the internet and retrieve specific datapoints about the competitor; company overview, product offering and customer reviews.
* Once the agents are finished, the results are compiled into a report which is then inserted in a notion database.

Check out an example output here: https://jimleuk.notion.site/2d1c3c726e8e42f3aecec6338fd24333?v=de020fa196f34cdeb676daaeae44e110&pvs=4

## Requirements

* An OpenAI account for the LLM.
* Exa.ai account for access to their AI search engine.
* SerpAPI account for Google search.
* Firecrawl.dev account for webscraping.
* Notion.com account for database to save final reports.

## Customising the workflow

Add additional agents to gather more datapoints such as SEO keywords and metrics.

Not using notion? Feel free to swap this out for your own database.

parameters.content:
## Try It Out!

### This workflow builds a competitor research agent using Exa.ai as a starting point. The HTTP Request tool is used to demonstrate how you can build powerful agents with minimal effort.

* Using Exa's findSimilar search, we ask it to look for similar companies ie. competitors, to our source company.
* This list of competitors is sent to 3 agents to scour the internet to find company overview, product offering and customer reviews.
* A report is then compiled from the output of all 3 agents into a notion table.

### Need Help?
Join the [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io/)!

Happy Hacking!

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to read the contents of a crunchbase profile.
Call this tool to read the contents of a wellfound profile.
Call this tool to read the contents of a linkedin company profile. You must pass in the the linkedin.com url.
Call this tool to fetch any additional webpage and its contents which may be helpful in gathering information for the data points.

Call this tool to check if a company profile exists in either crunchbase, wellfound or linkedin.
* To check if a company has a crunchbase profile, use the query "site: https://crunchbase.com/organizations (company)"
* To check if a company has a wellfound profile, use the query "site: https://wellfound.com/company (company)"
* To check if a company has a linked company profile, use the query "site: https://linkedin.com/company (company)"
Call this tool to fetch webpage contents. Pass in the url to fetch.

Call this tool to query the company's profile website.
Examples could include "(company) pricing", "(company) plans", "(company) features" etc
Call this tool to search for customer reviews for the desired company or their product/service.

values.name: company_or_product
values.description: the name of the company or their product to search for reviews for

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to fetch webpage contents. Pass in the url to fetch.

values.name: url_or_link
values.description: the url or lik to the review site webpage.

parameters.toolDescription: Call this tool to search for the latest news articles of a company.

parameters.content:
## Step 1. Get Competitors
[Read more about using the HTTP Request node](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.httprequest)

Exa.ai is a relatively new AI search engine startup with a specialised API for finding similar companies.
This is perfect for marketing research as we can easily find competitors to compare against.

### ðŸš¨Required!
Remember to set your company here.

## Step 2. Feed into Agent Pipeline
[Learn more about loops](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.splitinbatches)

A loop is used to ensure competitors are processed one at a time. This is ideal when we don't want errors to fail the entire pipeline.

## Step 4. Research Competitor Product Offering
[Learn more about using AI Agents](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/root-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent)

This agent uses SERPAPI to discover the competitor's product pages. Once found, it will use the webscraping tool to fetch the page's contents to extract the necessary data points.

## Step 3. Discover Competitor Company and Funding Overview
[Learn more about using AI Agents](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/root-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent)

This agent searches crunchbase.com, wellfound.com and linkedin.com for the competitor's company details, people data, funding activity and latest news.

## Step 5. Capture Competitor Product Reviews
[Learn more about using AI Agents](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/root-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent)

This agent uses SERPAPI to discover product reviews for the competitor's product or service and then summarises the pros and cons.

assignments.name: output

parameters.content:
## Step 6. Collect Results and Send to Notion
[Read more about using Notion](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.notion)

Finally, once the agent's have completed their tasks successfully, we compiled a competitor report and insert it as a new row in our Notion table.
You can check out a copy of this table here: https://jimleuk.notion.site/2d1c3c726e8e42f3aecec6338fd24333?v=de020fa196f34cdeb676daaeae44e110&pvs=4

options.systemMessage:
Your role is a company researcher agent. Your goal is to research and discover the following information about a company:
* Year founded
* Founder(s)
* CEO
* Key people
* Employees
* Open jobs
* Offices
* Money raised
* Funding status
* Investors
* Customers
* YoY customer growth
* Annual revenue
* YoY revenue growth
* Latest articles

## Steps
1. check if the company's crunchbase profile exists and if it does read the profile page to gather the required information. If you are able to satisfies all data points from the profile, then do not return your response.
2. repeat step 1 for wellfound if there are missing data points on the crunchbase profile.
3. repeat step 1 for linkedin if there are missing data points on the wellfound profile.
4. If there are still missing datapoints after checking cruchbase, wellfound and linkedin then just give up and return your response.

If a data point is not found after completing all the above steps, do not use null values in your final response. Use either an empty array, object or string depending on the required schema for the data point.
Do not retry any link that returns a 400,401,403 or 500 error code.

Your role is company product/service researcher. Your goal is to search and collect the following information:
* features sets
* number of pricing plans
* Factors that impact price
* Lowest-tier, Mid-tier and Highest-tier price
* Custom plans if available
* Discounts & promotions offered currently
* whether a Free trial is offered
* description of freemium version if available
* Complementary tools offered
* technology used

# steps
1. Search for the relevant webpage on the company's website. This search should return a url address.
2. Use this url address with the webscraper tool to fetch the contents of the webpage.
3. Use the contents of th webpage to populate the data points.

If a data point is not found after completing all the above steps, do not use null values in your final response. Use either an empty array, object or string depending on the required schema for the data point.
Do not retry any link that returns a 400,401,403 or 500 error code.

Your role is customer reviews agent. Your goal is to gather and collect online customer reviews for a company or their product or service.
* number of reviews
* Positive mentions, %
* Negative mentions, %
* Top pros
* Top cons
* Top countries
* Top social media platforms

## steps
1. search for review sites that may have reviews for the company or product in question. retrieve the links or urls of the serch results where the reviews are found.
2. Identify relevant items in the search result and and extract the urls from the search results.
2. using the extracted urls from the search results, fetch the webpage of the review sites containing reviews for the company or product.
3. extract the reviews from the fetched review sites to populate the required data points.

If a data point is not found after completing all the above steps, do not use null values in your final response. Use either an empty array, object or string depending on the required schema for the data point.
Do not retry any link that returns a 400,401,403 or 500 error code.

Remember to set your Notion Database here.
